title: New York Is the Latest State to Consider a Data Center Pause
summary: Red and blue states alike have introduced legislation in recent weeks that would halt data center development, citing concerns from climate to high energy prices.

title: Extraordinary photo captures first appearance of Siberian peregrine falcon in Australia's arid center
summary: An ecologist has captured a photo of a peregrine falcon subspecies in an unprecedented location.

title: Scientist accidentally stumbles across bizarre ancient ‘wrinkle structures’ in Morocco that shouldn't be there
summary: Ancient fossil structures imprinted on rocks that were once deep beneath the ocean suggest the search for the first life on Earth needs to be broadened.

title: Bandera Volcano Ice Cave: The weird lava tube in New Mexico whose temperature is always below freezing
summary: Due to a weird quirk of geology, New Mexico's Bandera Volcano Ice Cave never warms above 31 degrees Fahrenheit, even when temperatures outside exceed 100 F in summer.

title: Figure Skaters at the 2026 Winter Olympics Are Pushing the Limits of What’s Possible
summary: For years, quad axel jumps seemed impossible. Then Ilia Malinin landed one in 2022. As he heads to the Milano Cortina Games, everyone wants to know what’s next.

title: Every major galaxy is speeding away from the Milky Way, except one — and we finally know why
summary: A vast, flat sheet of dark matter may solve the long-standing mystery of why our neighboring galaxy Andromeda is speeding toward us while our other neighbors are moving away from us.

title: Briefing Chat: 'External lungs' keep man alive for 48 hours until transplant
summary:
Nature, Published online: 06 February 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00397-z

Nature staff discuss some of the week’s top science news.
body: Nature, Published online: 06 February 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00397-z Nature staff discuss some of the week’s top science news.

title: Epstein files reveal deeper ties to scientists than previously known
summary:
Nature, Published online: 06 February 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00388-0

Latest batch of documents show researchers consulting the financier and sex offender on publications, visas and more.
body: Nature, Published online: 06 February 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00388-0 Latest batch of documents show researchers consulting the financier and sex offender on publications, visas and more.

title: Two Titanic Structures Hidden Deep Within the Earth Have Altered the Magnetic Field for Millions of Years
summary: A team of geologists found for the first time evidence linking regions of low seismic velocity and the shape of the Earth’s magnetic field.

title: Spotted lanternflies are invading the US. They may have gotten their evolutionary superpowers in China's cities.
summary: The alarming spread of spotted lanternflies across the U.S. has been made possible by cities acting as evolutionary incubators, fine-tuning the insects and enabling them to thrive.

title: The 2026 Winter Olympics Will Have a Major Impact on the Region’s Snow
summary: A recent report found that carbon emissions caused by the Milano Cortina Olympics could lead to the loss of 5.5 square kilometers of snowpack and millions of metric tons of glacial ice.

title: Black hole outburst named 'Jetty McJetface' is one of the most energetic objects in the universe
summary: Scientists say a jet from a previously studied supermassive black hole has grown brighter, becoming one of the most energetic events in the universe.

title: 7,500-year-old deer skull headdress discovered in Germany indicates hunter-gatherers shared sacred items and ideas with region's first farmers
summary: The discovery of a deer skull headdress and tools made from antlers at the site of a New Stone Age farming village suggests that hunter-gatherers were sharing ideas with the newcomers.

title: Saltwater crocodiles crossed the Indian Ocean to reach the Seychelles — before humans arrived and wiped them out
summary: A DNA study reveals crocs that lived in the Seychelles represented the westernmost population of saltwater crocodiles, having swam at least 1,800 miles to reach the island.

title: The US will see a rare 'blood moon' eclipse before sunrise this March: Where and when to look
summary: A rare total lunar eclipse will be visible from most of the United States on March 3. Here's where and when to look.

title: Remote region in Greece has one of the most genetically distinct populations in Europe
summary: A genetic analysis of the Deep Maniots living in Greece's southern Peloponnese region has revealed a close-knit, patriarchal community with roots in the Bronze Age.

title: Life-friendly molecules are leaking out of Jupiter's giant moon Europa, Galileo images hint
summary: A new finding of ammonia on the icy surface of Jupiter's moon Europa could have important implications for the search for extraterrestrial life.

title: 'Behemoth star,' previously thought to be dying, is 'rising from the ashes' like a phoenix
summary: A new study suggests that the red supergiant WOH G64, also known as the "behemoth star," has not transitioned into a yellow hypergiant as previous research suggested. This means it is now unlikely to imminently explode in a colossal supernova.

title: New map shows weird magnetic anomaly lurking beneath Australia's Northern Territory
summary: Advanced modeling has revealed an Australia-shaped magnetic anomaly beneath the country's Northern Territory that holds valuable information about Australia's geological history.

title: 'Textbooks will need to be updated': Jupiter is smaller and flatter than we thought, Juno spacecraft reveals
summary: Jupiter is smaller and flatter than scientists previously thought, new measurements of the gas giant reveal.

title: Grim photo captures polar bear mom and cubs resting in mud in summer heat
summary: An image of polar bears napping along the Hudson Bay coast in Canada has been shortlisted for the Wildlife Photographer of the Year Nuveen People's Choice Award 2026.

title: A deer carrying the rotting head of its vanquished foe and a playful lynx shortlisted for Wildlife Photographer of the Year Nuveen People's Choice Award
summary: Here are the 24 images shortlisted for the Wildlife Photographer of the Year Nuveen People's Choice Award 2026.

title: NIH rolls back red tape on some experiments — spurring excitement and concern
summary:
Nature, Published online: 04 February 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00337-x

Some human research will no longer be classified as a clinical trial, easing the paperwork burden, but not everyone agrees with the approach.
body: Nature, Published online: 04 February 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00337-x Some human research will no longer be classified as a clinical trial, easing the paperwork burden, but not everyone agrees with the approach.

title: Asteroid 2024 YR4's collision with the moon could create a flash visible from Earth, study finds
summary: If the building-size asteroid 2024 YR4 crashes into the moon in December 2032, the impact will produce a bright flash that may be visible to the naked eye, a new study finds.

title: In the search for bees, Mozambique honey hunters and birds share a language with distinct, regional dialects
summary: People searching for honey in Mozambique work with birds via a shared language in a rare case of cooperation between humans and wild animals. This language also comes with regional dialects — that appear to be driven by the birds.

title: Physicists push thousands of atoms to a 'Schrödinger's cat' state — bringing the quantum world closer to reality than ever before
summary: Researchers have demonstrated that a nanoparticle of 7,000 sodium atoms can act as a wave, creating a record-setting superposition.

title: شجاعة استثنائية.. سبح ساعات في عرض البحر لإنقاذ أسرته
summary: أشاد عناصر الإنقاذ الأستراليون بشجاعة فتى مراهق سبح لأربع ساعات وسط الأمواج قبالة سواحل أستراليا بحثا عمّن ينقذ عائلته.

title: Auroras likely as most active sunspot in years turns toward Earth
summary: The sunspot region 4366 fired off dozens of powerful solar flares in 24 hours, including the single strongest flare since 2024. Auroras are possible later this week.

title: لصلته بإبستين.. استقالة سياسي بريطاني من "حزب العمال"
summary: قال السياسي البريطاني بيتر ماندلسون إنه استقال من عضوية حزب العمال لتجنب التسبب للحزب في "مزيد من الإحراج" عقب تكشف معلومات جديدة حول صداقته مع جيفري إبستين.

title: 'It's similar to how Google can map your home without your consent': Why using aerial lasers to map an archaeology site should have Indigenous partnership
summary: Aerial lidar is transforming how archaeologists map sites, but they should do it in tandem with Indigenous people.

title: صدمة للدروس الخصوصية.. إقبال على حصص الإنترنت بمصر
summary: تتلقى الدروس الخصوصية صدمة قوية في مصر حاليا، مع تزايد الإقبال بشكل ملحوظ حصص التعليم عبر الإنترنت، والصفحات الخاصة بعدد من مشاهير المعلمين عبر مواقع التواصل الاجتماعي، وموقع "يوتيوب"، والتي تقدم الخدمات المجانية للطلاب من مراحل التعليم المختلفة.

title: دمية "الحصان الباكي" تحصد الإعجاب في الصين
summary: في مدينة ييوو للتجارة الدولية، أكبر سوق للجملة في الصين، يتزاحم الزبائن في متجر صغير بحثا عن سلعة رائجة بشكل غير متوقع قبل حلول السنة القمرية الجديدة.

title: سباق مع الزمن.. عشرات طُمروا تحت "جبل نفايات" في الفلبين
summary: يواصل عناصر الإنقاذ، السبت، مستخدمين الجرافات عمليات البحث عن ناجين بين أكوام القمامة عقب انهيار مكب نفايات في وسط الفلبين، مما أدى إلى دفن عشرات من عمال النظافة ومقتل ستة منهم على الأقل.
